title: Decompose a 16-bit binary number into four 4-bit binary numbers
description:
In some data processing and communication applications, it is necessary to decompose a 16-bit binary number into four independent 4-bit binary numbers. For example, such decomposition operations may be required during data encoding, decoding, or data exchange with external systems.
Control requirements:
The system needs to receive a 16-bit binary number InputWord as input.
Decompose the input 16-bit binary number into four 4-bit binary numbers, corresponding to the lowest to the highest bits of the input number.
Output these four 4-bit binary numbers to independent variables Byte0~Byte3.
At the same time, calculate the average of the non-zero variables among these four variables Byte0~Byte3 and output it to average.
For example, if InputWord=16#1203, then Byte0=3, Byte1=0, Byte2=2, Byte3=1, and the average value average=(1+2+3)/3
name: FB_SplitWordIntoBytes

output.name: Byte1
output.description: The second lowest 4-bit binary number output

output.name: Byte2
output.description: The second highest 4-bit binary number output

output.name: average
output.description: The average of non-zero bytes among the four bytes
